t: God Alone a Refuge from Treachery and Oppression.
For the choir director; according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.
My*pn soul waits*i in silence for God only; From*ln Him is my salvation.
He*ln only is my rock and my salvation, My*ln stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.
How*ln long will you assail a man, That*ln you may murder him,*i all of you, Like*ln a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?
They*ln have counseled only to thrust him down from his high position; They*ln delight in falsehood; They*ln bless with their mouth, But*ln inwardly they curse. Selah.
My*ln soul, wait in silence for God only, For*ln my hope is from Him.
He*ln only is my rock and my salvation, My*ln stronghold; I shall not be shaken.
On*ln God my salvation and my glory rest;*i The*ln rock of my strength, my refuge is in God.
Trust*ln in Him at all times, O people; Pour*ln out your heart before Him; God*ln is a refuge for us. Selah.
Men*ln of low degree are only vanity and men of rank are a lie; In*ln the balances they go up; They*ln are together lighter than breath.
Do*ln not trust in oppression And*ln do not vainly hope in robbery; If*ln riches increase, do not set your*i heart upon*i them.*i
Once*ln God has spoken; Twice*ln I have heard this: That*ln power belongs to God;
And*ln lovingkindness is Yours, O Lord, For*ln You recompense a man according to his work.
